metadata.feature_description: Monitors and reports Active Directory connection status and availability

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems
steps.expected: AD Authentication extension should be listed
steps.actual: DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication extension found in Authentication Systems list

steps.action: Click on DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication extension and select Site Settings tab
steps.expected: AD authentication configuration form should be displayed
steps.actual: Site Settings tab displayed the authentication configuration form with all expected fields

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Network Status Display on Save (Unreachable Domain)

steps.action: Enable Windows Authentication checkbox and click Update Authentication Settings
steps.expected: Network Status should be displayed showing connection status for Global Catalog, Root Domain, LDAP, and Network Domains
steps.actual: Network Status monitoring triggered and displayed an error message indicating the AD connection is unavailable. The error showed the full stack trace from GetNetworkStatus() method at ADSIProvider.cs:line 506

steps.expected: Error should indicate connection failure to Active Directory
steps.actual: Error displayed: 'Error: is currently unavailable. DotNetNuke.Services.Exceptions.ModuleLoadException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object' with stack trace showing the GetNetworkStatus() method was called and failed as expected when no AD is available

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Status Updates After Configuration Changes

steps.action: Disable Windows Authentication checkbox and click Update Authentication Settings
steps.expected: Settings should save without displaying network status (since provider is disabled)
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully without network status check. The message cell remained empty, confirming that network status is only checked when the provider is enabled

observations: The Network Status Monitoring feature is implemented in ADSIProvider.GetNetworkStatus() method which checks: Global Catalog Status, Root Domain Status, LDAP Status, and Network Domains Status
When no Active Directory environment is available, the feature correctly reports an error with detailed exception information
The feature displays status as a colored message: green for success, red for failure (as seen in the error message styling)
Network status is only checked when the Windows Authentication provider is enabled

Testing with valid AD connection, invalid credentials, and LDAP status reporting could not be performed as no Active Directory environment was available in the test environment. These scenarios require an actual AD infrastructure to test properly.
The error message localization is implemented in the LocalizedStatus() method which translates status labels like '[Global Catalog Status]', '[LDAP Status]', etc.
